title: Calories in Spring Rolls
meta_description: Discover calories in spring rolls, including macros like carbs, protein, fat, per-roll nutrition, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Vegetable-filled spring rolls, fried, medium size (~50 g each), no dipping sauce included.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by filling, size, frying method, brand, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One typical fried vegetable spring roll contains about 120 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: With 1 tbsp sweet chili dipping sauce

faqs.q: How many calories in one spring roll?
faqs.a: About 120 kcal for a medium fried vegetable spring roll.

faqs.q: Are spring rolls high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 15 g carbs per roll, mainly from the wrapper and veggies.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in spring rolls?
faqs.a: Typically 6 g total fat per roll, with 1 g saturated, from frying oil.

faqs.q: Do baked spring rolls have fewer calories?
faqs.a: Yes, baking reduces calories by about 40 kcal per roll compared to frying.

faqs.q: How does sodium vary in spring rolls?
faqs.a: Around 300 mg per roll; sauces or store-bought versions can increase it significantly.
